column1: 4.2.3.4	  Urodynamics  The role of urodynamics in SUI evaluation remains poorly defined and is still under debate.

Perform preoperative urodynamic tests in cases of SUI with associated storage symptoms,   cases in which the type of incontinence is unclear, cases in which voiding dysfunction is   suspected, and cases with associated pelvic organ prolapse or prior surgery for SUI.
Perform urodynamic tests if the findings may change the choice of invasive treatment.
Do not use urethral pressure profilometry or leak point pressure to grade severity of   incontinence as they are primarily tests of urethral function.
